summary: This is an FBI email dated August 20, 2019, providing an update on the OIG (Office of the Inspector General) investigation into the death of Jeffrey Epstein. It details interviews conducted with Bureau of Prisons (BOP) personnel and inmates at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) regarding possible document shredding and the circumstances surrounding Epstein's death.

persons.name: Steven Lopez
persons.context: Inmate at MCC interviewed by OIG regarding possible shredding of Epstein documents; he had no information or knowledge of any suspicious acts.

persons.name: Christian Perez
persons.context: Inmate scheduled for a proffer session (interview) the day after this email was sent, as part of the OIG investigation.

events.title: OIG Interviews at MCC/SDNY
events.description: The Office of the Inspector General conducted multiple interviews with BOP personnel and an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center and SDNY regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein and possible document shredding.

events.title: Scheduled BOP Interviews and Inmate Proffer
events.description: Three interviews of BOP personnel and one proffer session with inmate Christian Perez were scheduled for the day following this email.

locations: SDNY (likely referring to the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, or Southern District of New York facilities)
keyFacts: The OIG was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein's death and possible related document shredding shortly after it occurred.
Inmate Steven Lopez was interviewed and reported no knowledge of any suspicious acts or document shredding.
At least one BOP guard requested an attorney immediately upon being interviewed, halting the interview.
Another BOP guard who worked the 8x4 shift in the SHU (Special Housing Unit) was interviewed and was not working when Epstein was found; no irregularities were reported.
The investigation was ongoing with multiple interviews scheduled, including a proffer session with inmate Christian Perez.
